holisticai.bias.mitigation.FairKCenterClustering¶

class holisticai.bias.mitigation.FairKCenterClustering(*args, **kwargs)¶

Fair K-Center Clustering inprocessing bias mitigation implements an approximation algorithm for the k-centers problem under the fairness contraint with running time linear in the size of the dataset and k (number of cluster).

Kleindessner, Matthäus, Pranjal Awasthi, and Jamie Morgenstern. “Fair k-center clustering for data summarization.” International Conference on Machine Learning. PMLR, 2019.

__init__(req_nr_per_group: Optional[list] = [200, 200], nr_initially_given: Optional[int] = 100, strategy: Optional[str] = 'Fair K-Center', seed: Optional[int] = None)¶

Parameters

req_nr_per_grouplist

Number of cluster for each group that will be founded. - Integer-vector of length m with entries in 0,…,k. - Sum of all entries must be equal to k (total number of clusters).

nr_initially_given: int

Number of initial random centers.

strategy: Strategy used to compute the cluster centers. Available are:

  • ‘Fair K-Center’ (default)

  • ‘Heuristic Greedy by Group’

  • ‘Heuristic Greedy by Constraint’

seed: int,

Initial random seed.

set_params(**params)¶

Set the parameters of this estimator.

The method works on simple estimators as well as on nested objects (such as Pipeline). The latter have parameters of the form <component>__<parameter> so that it’s possible to update each component of a nested object.
